article.headline: UC Riverside 82, Texas-San Antonio 75
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. -- Phil Martin and Javon Borum scored 22 points apiece Thursday night as UC Riverside defeated UTSA 82-75. Kareem Nitoto added 19 points for the Highlanders (3-4), who broke a two-game losing streak. Tyquan Brown grabbed a game-high 11 rebounds. Devin Gibson's 21 points led the Roadrunners (4-2), whose three-game winning streak ended. Jeromie Hill had 14 points and a team-best eight rebounds, and Melvin Johnson III scored 13. The Highlanders lit it up from 3-point range. Nitoto made four and Martin and Borum three each, combining to sink all of their team's 10 3-pointers. Riverside went 10 of 21 (47.6 percent). UC Riverside outrebounded UTSA 42-36 but committed 16 turnovers to only nine for the Roadrunners. The Highlanders led by eight points early, then broke open a tight game in the second half, turning a 40-38 halftime edge into an 11-point lead at 53-42.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
